briefdescription.para: Adds or replaces a tab stop in the collection.

detaileddescription.para: If a tab stop already exists at the specified position, it is replaced.

briefdescription.para: Adds or replaces a tab stop in the collection.

detaileddescription.para: If a tab stop already exists at the specified position, it is replaced.

briefdescription.para: Gets a first tab stop to the right of the specified position.

detaileddescription.para: Skips tab stops with Alignment set to TabAlignment.Bar.

briefdescription.para: Gets a first tab stop to the left of the specified position.

detaileddescription.para: Skips tab stops with Alignment set to TabAlignment.Bar.

briefdescription.para: Determines whether the specified TabStopCollection is equal in value to the current TabStopCollection.
Determines whether the specified object is equal in value to the current object.
Gets the number of tab stops in the collection.
Serves as a hash function for this type.
Gets the index of a tab stop with the specified position in points.
Gets the position (in points) of the tab stop at the specified index.
Gets a tab stop at the specified position.
Gets a tab stop at the given index.
Removes a tab stop at the specified index from the collection.
Removes a tab stop at the specified position from the collection.
A collection of TabStop objects that represent custom tabs for a paragraph or a style.

detaileddescription.para: In Microsoft Word documents, a tab stop can be defined in the properties of a paragraph style or directly in the properties of a paragraph. A style can be based on another style. Therefore, the complete set of tab stops for a given object is a combination of tab stops defined directly on this object and tab stops inherited from the parent styles.

In Aspose.Words, when you obtain a TabStops collection for a paragraph or a style, it contains only the custom tab stops defined directly for this paragraph or style. The collection does not include tab stops defined in the parent styles or default tab stops.
